title: Aural set, In the Mood - saxophone arpeggiation

content.description: You will hear an excerpt consisting of the introduction and first chorus of a jazz piece. First, you will hear the entire excerpt. Then the introduction will be played twice, followed by two playings of the chorus. Finally, the entire excerpt will be played again. Before each listening, please read the questions.
content.question: The arpeggiated chord played at the beginning by the saxophone section is a

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

topic.text: 3.3: Chord Inversions and Figures - Introduction to Figured Bass

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
